intro: Erigeron borealis, commonly known as the northern fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, roadsides, and gravelly soils. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early autumn, producing white to pale yellow flowers. Erigeron borealis is often found in the Arctic tundra and subarctic regions, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
